intro: Carex brevifolia, commonly known as the shortleaf sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its grass-like leaves that are typically narrow and grass-green in color. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are usually borne on slender, leafy stems. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along stream banks. Carex brevifolia plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
